title: ICE with const generics canonicalisation: "assertion failed: !out_value.has_type_flags(TypeFlags::KEEP_IN_LOCAL_TCX)"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I started to further investigate the bug blocking #62959. The following is a minimised test case:

```rust
#![feature(const_generics)]

pub struct Foo<T, const N: usize>([T; N]);

impl<T, const N: usize> Foo<T, {N}> {
    pub fn new() -> Self {
        unimplemented!()
    }
}

fn main() {
    let _: Foo<u32, 0> = Foo::new();
}
```

Results in (with debug assertions enabled):

```
warning: the feature `const_generics` is incomplete and may cause the compiler to crash
 --> const-bug.rs:1:12
  |
1 | #![feature(const_generics)]
  |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !out_value.has_type_flags(TypeFlags::KEEP_IN_LOCAL_TCX)', src/librustc/infer/canonical/canonicalizer.rs:548:9
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.40.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```

Here with the backtrace:
